hackathon-description-text: Clear your calendar! Hack It Together kicks off on February 26th, and you're invited to take part in the festivities. Lander College for Women (227 West 60th Street) is our meeting spot for a day of fun, excitement, and coding - just for women. Come one, come all, and bring your friends for a chance to improve your programming skills, meet other women in tech, and have fun. This is going to be epic!
hackathon-eligibility: Hackers must to be students or learning how to code, not professionals already in the field.
hackathon-rules: -No coding until the actual hackathon (brainstorm beforehand and come prepared!)
hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=227 W 60th St, New York, NY 10023, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Does the project have real social impact? Can it change the world, or at least help someone in your community? Does the hack solve a real problem?
Is the solution novel? Did the team solve their problem in a creative or never-seen-before way?
Did they solve a hard technical problem? Did they get a working demo completed within the allotted time?
Is the project conducive to work at scale? Could the project succeed if it were to be built up for widespread use? Does the project have potential to succeed in the outside world?

hackathon-location-address: 227 W 60th St, New York, NY 10023, USA
